document.docAuthor: Gustafsson, Daniel R., Lei, Lujia, Chu, Xingzhi & Zou, Fasheng
document.docTitle: Sinolipeurus sichuanensis Gustafsson & Lei & Chu & Zou 2020, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Review of Chinese species of the Oxylipeurus - complex (Phthiraptera: Philopteridae), with descriptions of two new genera and five new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of Chinese species of the Oxylipeurus - complex (Phthiraptera: Philopteridae), with descriptions of two new genera and five new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Sinolipeurus sichuanensis
n. sp.
can be separated from
S. tetraophasis
by the following characters: (1) head smaller and proportionately more slender in
S. sichuanensis
( Fig. 20 ) than in
S. tetraophasis
( Fig. 19 ); (2) proximal mesosome small and with distally slightly diverging lateral margins in
S. sichuanensis
( Fig. 68 ), but larger and with distally converging lateral margins in
S. tetraophasis
( Fig. 65 ); (3) antero-lateral hooks of mesosome more pronounced in
S. tetraophasis
( Fig. 65 ) than in
S. sichuanensis
( Fig. 68 ); (4) gonopores with different shape ( Figs 65, 68 ); (5) parameres with different shapes ( Figs 64, 67 ).

Male. Head broad, frons broadly rounded ( Fig. 20 ). Marginal carina slender. Head chaetotaxy as in Fig. 20 . Lateral margins of postantennal head converging posteriorly. Thoracic and abdominal plates and chaetotaxy as in Fig. 20 . Reticulation only visible on pterosternal plate, metepisterna, and sternal and subgenital plates. Antennae as in Fig. 32 ; tooth-like projection of scape prominent; rugose area of flagellomere I not visible. Accessory sternal plate present ( Fig. 87 ). Stylus long, slender, spatulate, distal end with sinusoid margins ( Fig. 87 ). Basal apodeme broad, proximal end diffuse ( Fig. 66 ). Proximal mesosome small, square-shaped, lateral margins diverging distally ( Fig. 68 ); distal mesosome with slight submedian lobes, densely rugose; antero-lateral and lateral lobes as in Fig. 68 . Gonopore and ventral sclerite as in Fig. 68 . Parameres as in Fig. 67 ; pst2 sensillus. Measurements as in Table 1 .
Etymology. The specific epithet is derived from the type locality, Sichuan Province , China .

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype
♂ , Szechwan [= Sichuan Province , China ],
Apr. 1908
, R . Meinertzhagen , 3756, NHMUK0106827630 ( NHML ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. The slide containing the holotype of
Sinolipeurus sichuanensis
also has a female. This specimen differs from the male in the shape and structure of the head and the shape of the pleural incrassations; therefore, we do not regard it as conspecific with the male holotype . That female is similar, but not identical, to females of
Reticulipeurus ithaginis
we have examined. Thus, we believe the female on slide NHMUK0106827630 may represent an undescribed species of
Reticulipeurus
from
Tragopan temminckii
or from an unknown host.

The holotype of
Sinolipeurus sichuanensis
has asymmetrical sternal plates V–VII. Plates V–VI are fused on one side but separate on the other side, and plate VII is reduced anteriorly on one side ( Figs 18 , 20 ). No sts are present on the fused side of sternal plates V–VI, but two setae are present on the non-fused side. We regard these asymmetries to be teratologies in the single male of
S. sichuanensis
examined.
